description: Used when the level or degree is high/amazing. Originated from 'Yánzhí hěn néng dǎ' (looks are top-tier/can fight), but 'néng dǎ' is now used on its own.

examples.chinese: 现在的运动员,颜值都很能打
examples.translation: Athletes these days all have top-tier looks.

examples.chinese: 这手机真全面屏颜值真能打
examples.translation: This phone's full screen looks really amazing.

examples.chinese: 你的能力很能打,不服不行啊
examples.translation: Your ability is top-tier, I have to admit it.

examples.chinese: 苹果的拍照能打得过三星吗
examples.translation: Can Apple's camera compete with Samsung's?

examples.chinese: 这次广告效果真的太能打了
examples.translation: The advertising effect this time is really top-tier.
